job_desc: What impact will you make? The Opportunity The Capital Markets Operations practice has a history of building deep and long lasting relationships with our clients. We are proud to provide an unrivalled service and experience through a collaborative partnership with our clients to maximise their effectiveness, efficiency and profitability. Our team is passionate about delivering change to the financial services industry, with digital innovation at the heart of our approach. Our practitioners work on a variety of projects which include, design and delivery of operating models, process transformation and automation, robotics, cost reduction, structural reform and regulatory compliance. The Capital Markets Operations team recognises that our success in the industry is due to our incredible people. We invest heavily in our practitioners providing them with the right tools, training and working flexibility to enable them to deliver and be successful in a rewarding and motivating working environment. Teamwork is also something that we emphasise and bring the Capital Markets Operations team together on a regular basis to share experiences, knowledge, while enjoying quality time with our colleagues. As a Senior Consultant in Capital Markets Operations you will work on complex and challenging projects within the Capital Markets industry and across a variety of functions (e.g. operations, front office, risk, compliance, etc.). You will have the opportunity to learn and grow by using the practice’s sophisticated tools and methodologies, whilst having the opportunity to build meaningful client relationships. You will also have the chance to work with and learn from some of the top practitioners in our firm.  Role description To be successful in this role, you will need to have had exposure to project work and be able to understand front-to-back operations as well as the full trade life cycle so that you can translate your findings into tangible solutions. You should also be able to develop strong relationships, contribute innovative ideas, and manage change and ambiguity effectively and confidently. Your existing industry and project management knowledge/experience will be critical and will support your development in the team. We will provide you with the appropriate support to continually develop yourself, add real value and build credibility in the industry from an early stage.Assignments will be focused across the full spectrum of the capital markets industry and will include:Legal Entity Strategy design and implementation Business Booking Models Optimisation Operating model design and implementation Business architecture Regulatory change analysis and implementation  Location London Hours Permanent role with potential for flexible working Responsibilities As a Senior Consultant focussing on Structural Reform in Capital Markets Operations, you will be responsible for understanding the clients' needs and supporting the client with:Entity Strategy for transformation programmes impacting Capital Markets entities; Identifying the regulations affecting the design of a bank’s new strategic structure and booking model for clients; Understanding the impact of “ring fencing” assets / liabilities or businesses on a Bank’s business model and wider considerations perspective; Producing quality deliverables with minimum management oversight This could entail designing and implementing operating models for transformation programmes; Translating regulatory requirements into tangible business transformation and improvements; Analysing processes and functions' cost basis to identify cost reduction opportunities; Documenting, designing, improving or transforming processes using traditional lean methods e.g. robotics, digital solutions and blockchain; Developing new processes and/or business requirements for the relevant functions;You will also be expected to lead and manage more junior team members as well as to support internal projects and business development work.  Requirements To qualify for the role you must have:A background of working Capital Markets Experience in investment banking and capital markets industry, e.g. instruments, such as OTC derivatives, bonds, futures and money market, front-, middle- or back-office processes, market infrastructure, etc. Knowledge of key Structural Reform Initiatives (e.g. Ring fencing / Liikanen, Recovery and Resolution Planning) Experience of one or more elements considered in a legal entity and business booking optimisation programme: This may be for instance ring-fence design, control function design, regulatory capital, liquidity, treasury, Brexit impact analysis, subsidiarisation. Strong understanding and experience of the project lifecycle A thorough understanding of all aspects of the Target Operating Model framework and have had some project experience / exposure to certain components within it Experience managing / mentoring at least 1-2 junior resources Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong problem solving and analytical skills Good relationship management skills Advanced PowerPoint and Excel skills Good project management Proven change management and change delivery ability Travel mobilityAdditional desirable experience includes: Digital change, e.g. new technologies experience, delivery of innovative ideas Experience in implementation of RPA of cognitive technologies Process modelling (e.g. Visio) You are here Three core competency areas make up our Consulting service line: Technology Strategy & Operations Human CapitalWe exist to solve complex problemsOur consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. With a team of over 3,000, each of us is energised by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.We are committed to collaborationOur role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities. We create long-term, sustainable impactWe often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come. We offer a number of different career pathwaysWe offer three different career pathways at Deloitte, meaning that there are three different routes by which people can progress in Consulting. We provide variety regarding the career options available to you, assisting you to take career steps that fit your skills, talents and aspirations, and providing an environment where those choices can be discussed in meaningful and constructive career conversations.The Consulting Career Paths are:Consulting pathway – pathway based around developing a broad consulting skillset alongside building expertise in a specific domain Consulting Solutions pathway – pathway where there is greater focus on building skills and deep expertise in a specific domain. Practitioners have a narrow focus, determined by their SME and type of contribution made Consulting Services pathway – pathway for people whose career is built around the delivery of managed services to clients (either internal or external) Read moreSee All
job_title: Deloitte Consulting, Senior Consultant, Capital Markets Operations (Structural Reform), Strategy & Operations

job_desc: A requirement for a Flow Manager or Product Manager has arisen in a well funded (over $20 million) project in the City of London to quite literally change the world by working on a digital decentralisation platform for people to build safely onto the blockchain.  This role has arisen from a Kanban project requirement of managing day to day operations on the board and the interaction between the teams to ensure smooth work flow and product completion. The project is running on a very flat structure so there is no room for hierarchical behavior or politics in the team, everyone works together to do their job as best they can.  Your responsibilities in this role will be to: Look after team requirements.Make sure each team has what they need to collaborate together, clearing any blockages.Coordinate daily stand-ups, see what has been done.Be a point of contact for any issues flagged up and facilitate resolution.Collaborate with product owner ensuring owners understand the tasks coming onto the board. The most important background and experience/skills required are: A Scrum Master who has perhaps moved across to KANBAN and adapted wellExperience of deploying and managing Kanban for delivery teamsUnderstand hierarchical boards and the use of resource (capability) poolsFamiliar with CFD (cumulative flow diagrams) and scatter diagrams and their use to manage outcomes.Understand the product management role and how it interfaces to the delivery teamsExposure to upstream or discovery Kanban to compliment the delivery teamsKnowledge of electronics boards for management of multiple and remote delivery teams.Someone with a high empathy who has worked around development groups, is fairly hands on and open minded. This job was originally posted as www.totaljobs.com/job/81265904 Read moreSee All

job_desc: Job ID 23710BR Job Title Technology Lawyer - Perm - London or Birmingham Country United Kingdom Location Birmingham  London Local Specialism Firmwide - all specialisms Line of Service Internal Firm Services Industry Legal Position Type Full Time Contract Type Permanent Job Description Who we are looking forPwC is the No 1 professional services network in the world with more than 208,000 professionals operating in 157 countries. In the UK, PwC has 4 lines of service (Assurance, Consulting, Deals and Tax) and turnover of more than £3 billion. The UK Office of the General Counsel (OGC) has 30 lawyers and provides PwC with legal and commercial advice in 3 main areas: Litigation, Counselling/Contracting and Corporate Transactions.  The commercial and corporate teams work across the whole UK business dealing with contracts in all of our lines of services handling a wide range of challenging and significant contracts and alliances. Many of our contracts have an international aspect, and our expertise is also drawn upon by other firms within the PwC network across Europe, the Middle East and Africa. It is a multi-disciplinary team comprising 14 lawyers and 1 paralegal.  We are looking to expand our capabilities in the technology, digital and software sectors to deal with significant growth in our UK business in these areas. This is an area of major focus for PwC in the UK and globally, and a key part of PwC’s growth strategy.  The work is demanding, the deals are varied, and no day will be the same. You will be able to assimilate information quickly, get to the heart of a deal and advise the business on the legal, commercial and reputational issues that arise. You will work closely with our delivery teams, you will have direct access to our clients and their legal team and will act very much as the face of PwC in technology transactions and development. The existing team is highly valued by the business and we are very much seen as business enablers.  You will have at least 5+ years of experience in providing legal advice, either within an in-house environment or within law firms working with clients in the technology, digital and software sectors. You will also have an ability to work internationally and travel when necessary, will have excellent communication skills, the ability to build strong relationships and the capability to determine strategy and influence negotiations in an innovative business environment.  The role is based in Central London at our award winning Embankment Place offices.About the rolePwC UK is the largest professional services firm in the UK and a member of the world's leading network. It is a dynamic and innovative organisation with a clear growth agenda. The need for an additional member of the legal team arises due the ever increasing needs of the business as a result of its strategy for technology growth and innovation in areas such as data analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, blockchain applications, use of unmanned aircraft (drones), robotics, augmented reality, cyber security, and the “internet of things”.  The legal team is a highly experienced, well established and supportive group of professionals, who are highly regarded by and well networked to the business, who have strong relationships with a wide range of senior professionals in the organisation, including at Executive Board level.  The successful applicant will join our in house legal team's Commercial Contracting group, and will be part of our team advising on all technology related initiatives.The role would be specifically to:Advise on and negotiate a wide range of deals for the development, licensing and exploitation of software, including the creation of new software products for internal use by PwC and/or to license to clients.Advise on software product development matters, such as the use of free and open source software, ‘white labelling’ third party products, and the use of SaaS and on-premise licensing models.Advise on alliance agreements with PwC’s technology partners, including reseller, OEM and subcontracting arrangements.Advise on the intellectual property and data protection aspects of any given deal.Advise on complex technology transformation consulting engagements (e.g. SAP, Oracle, Microsoft etc), where PwC may be acting as prime contractor or subcontractor.Advise on post-contract matters to protect PwC’s commercial and legal position.Become a trusted adviser to business leaders and proactively lead the legal aspects of our technology strategy for the future.Create new precedent agreements and guidance notes for use throughout PwC’s business.Work in collaboration with the wider network on both internal and external technology initiativesAdvise on acquisitions, new business set ups, deal structures and joint ventures with a technology focus.Consult with and work closely as part of the in-house legal team. The successful candidate will have access to the broad range of training and developmental opportunities available to staff at PwC and will come in to a defined career structure. PwC actively encourages the development of its staff and on-going training and development is embedded within the day to day.  The role also provides the opportunity to be involved in and drive other commercial work and projects across the business. Role Requirements:Detailed knowledge of English Law, at least 5+ years PQE (or equivalent);Worked in-house for a technology/software company, or if in a law firm you will have worked with clients in the technology, digital and software sectors;Keen interest in new technology;Proven track record in negotiating deals for IT consulting services projects, and the development, licensing and other forms of commercial exploitation of IP;Working knowledge of data protection and the forthcoming challenges of GDPR will be an advantage;Ability to handle complex negotiations using sound judgment to ensure that the firm’s best interests are served;Ability to gain a full appreciation of the wider reputational, commercial and business aspects of each deal;Ability to tailor advice to the specific needs of the business and apply common sense and practical solutions in a fast moving environment with new challenges arising every day;Ability to adapt, to change and to be open minded and innovative in your thinking;Strong drafting skills and the ability to flex communication style to suit a particular situation;Sound judgment and well developed influencing skills, together with the confidence to work with senior management across the business;An ability to build strong relationships and become a trusted advisor to the business;Appetite to learn and develop. About UsAbout PwC We’re one of the world’s leading professional services organisations. From 158 countries, we help our clients, some of the most successful organisations on the globe, as well as its most dynamic entrepreneurs and thriving private businesses, to create the value they want. We help to measure, protect and enhance the things that matter most to them. Internal firm services In order to deliver a first-class service to our clients, we need first-class support internally. Internal firm services is a network of specialist support professionals and includes marketing, recruitment, human capital, finance, technology, learning and development, procurement, to name but a few. Each team plays a vital role in making sure we have all the right resources, services and technology across our business. The skills we look for in future employees All our people need to demonstrate the skills and behaviours that support us in delivering our business strategy. This is important to the work we do for our business, and our clients. These skills and behaviours make up our global leadership framework, ‘The PwC Professional’ and are made up of five core attributes; whole leadership, technical capabilities, business acumen, global acumen and relationships.  Learn more here www.pwc.com/uk/careers/experienced/apply Diversity We work in a changing world which offers great opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool, as well as those who reflect the diverse nature of our society. And we aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. Creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business and as an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we're open to flexible working arrangements where appropriate.  Learn more here www.pwc.com/uk/diversity Read moreSee All

job_desc: Are you a Technical Lead with experience with Javascript/React.js and Node.js?  We have a Greenfield opportunity where you will build, train, and lead a London based tech team as well as enable clients to build on their Blockchain platform. This is an amazing opportunity as you'll be joining the business just as they're looking to scale up, meaning the chance to progress in your career will be huge! job_desc: Strategy & Operations, CFO Advisory– Manager, LondonWhat impact will you make? The OpportunityDeloitte’s CFO Advisory practice serves the broad needs of today’s CFO, delivering tailor made solutions to a range of multinational clients, helping to transform their Finance functions.  We advise the CFO on Finance strategy and vision, helping them define what Finance should be. We assess the health of the Finance function, conduct maturity assessments and benchmarking exercises as well as develop the Finance strategy. From this starting point, we have taken many organisations on a Finance Transformation journey that impacts the whole Finance Operating Model.  After a feasibility and business case exercise, we can support a Finance Target Operating Model design and can take this right through to implementation and post-Go-Live support. This includes establishing shared services, global business services, or business process outsourcing (BPO) solutions, as well as preparing Finance organisations for future ways of working in the digital world.  The Deloitte brand is synonymous with Finance, and we are uniquely positioned to work with the CFO and the Finance function to deliver the most complex and challenging transformation programmes. We are pioneers in Digital Finance and are helping our clients explore the art of the possible to build capabilities required to successfully operate in a Digital world. This means that our team members have the opportunity to develop their skills and experience in the most interesting and demanding projects and across the full project lifecycle, and to be at the forefront of Finance innovation.Role descriptionWe are looking for talented Managers with expertise in supporting the CFO’s agenda from a strategic, performance & profitability perspective. Areas where we are seeing an increasing demand are Digital Transformation, Transition Management, as well as Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) Advisory related services.  You'll take lead key projects with responsibility for managing teams, producing multiple deliverables across a variety of workstreams and building strong client relationships. You will also be supporting sales activities for high-profile bids in our target accounts. Working with a range of clients will also provide you with the opportunity to develop key relationships with industry leaders, and grow your leadership skills.  You will also play an important role for the growth and development of our teams and will, coach and support them through their careers, whilst driving activity such as proposition development, thought leadership and marketing.  By joining Deloitte, you will:   Have access to our broad range of market-leading services, propositions, assets, and our extensive knowledge base accumulated over hundreds of successful projects to develop your career   Continue to grow and develop your core skills, hone your industry expertise and truly reach your potential accessing the wealth of learning and development availableLocationYou will be based in a Deloitte London office, however travel will be required for client based projects. Whilst some clients are London based, we do spend time on site with regional and international clients. We specify full mobility for our consulting roles but we make arrangements respectfully, there may be some opportunity for working from home depending on client demands.HoursThis is a permanent role with a degree of flexibility. We do encourage careful consideration of agile ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients.Responsibilities Defining the Target Operating Model for Finance (i.e. identifying the future role of Finance, and understanding how it will deliver services to the business in terms of process, technology, people and organisation)   Helping Finance navigate the opportunities and challenges brought about by digital disruption and next generation finance technologies (e.g. robotics process automation, advanced analytics, next generation ERP, Blockchain)   Undertaking Finance diagnostic exercises to understand the 'health' of the Finance function and identifying what is required to solve the challenges it faces   Designing, building, and implementing components of the future Finance organisations, e.g. Finance organisation design, evaluating and selecting BPO providers, transitioning Finance activities to Shared Services and / or BPO providers, or defining best practice Finance processes   Understanding a client's unique situation and developing deliverables which exactly meet their needs   Performing complex financial analysis to support business case development and benefits realisation   Planning and managing a project work stream to time and to budget in support of the overall project plan   Managing and developing staff on projects   Inputting into proposals and identifying follow-on opportunities at existing clients   Building and maintaining strong client relationships   Supporting and leading bid and sales activities   Having a broader perspective of potential issues encountered when managing diverse teams and the strategies to overcome them; having a clear understanding of the firm’s commitment to creating a more inclusive cultureRequirements Minimum 2nd class degree or equivalent   Relevant experience in or around one or more of the Finance disciplines, i.e. Finance Operating Model, Shared Services / Global Business Services, Business Process Outsourcing, Finance Strategy, Finance Diagnostic, Process Reengineering incl. Six Sigma   Deep understanding of end-to-end Finance processes, especially Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Record to Report   Relevant experience in or around one or more of the Digital Finance capabilities, e.g. e.g. robotic process automation, advanced analytics, next generation ERP, Blockchain   Experience working with Lean / Agile development methodologies highly desirable   Deep knowledge in one or more industry sector   Prior consulting experience   Experience of the bid lifecycle   Ability to lead multi-functional teams of Deloitte, client and vendor resources   Strong career progression to date   Good communication, problem solving and project management skills   Full travel mobility   Qualified / Part Qualified ACA / CIMA / ACCA an advantageYou are here: ConsultingThree core competency areas make up our Consulting service line:  · Technology  · Strategy & Operations  · Human Capital  We exist to solve complex problems  · Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. With a team of over 3,000, each of us is energised by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact  · We are committed to collaboration  · Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.  · We create long-term, sustainable impact  · We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.  · We offer a number of different career pathways  · We offer three different career pathways at Deloitte, meaning that there are three different routes by which people can progress in Consulting. We provide variety regarding the career options available to you, assisting you to take career steps that fit your skills, talents and aspirations, and providing an environment where those choices can be discussed in meaningful and constructive career conversations. The Consulting Career Paths are:Consulting pathway – pathway based around developing a broad consulting skillset alongside building expertise in a specific domain Consulting Solutions pathway – pathway where there is greater focus on building skills and deep expertise in a specific domain. Practitioners have a narrow focus, determined by their SME and type of contribution made Consulting Services pathway – pathway for people whose career is built around the delivery of managed services to clients (either internal or external)About DeloitteOur Purpose & StrategyTo make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.What do we do?Deloitte offers Global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.What do we value?At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements. Hear from some of our people already working at Deloitte in agile ways. We are proud to have received a Best for All Stages of Motherhood special award in 2016 as a Top Employer for Working Families. Read moreSee All
job_title: Deloitte, Finance Consulting, Manager, CFO Advisory, Strategy & Operations

job_desc: Market Intelligence Manager Axiom, an industry pioneer and leading provider of legal technology and services to Fortune Global 2000 companies, is seeking an experienced Manager to lead both Market & Competitive Intelligence, based in either New York or San Francisco. The Role Axiom solutions fall under two broad umbrellas: Our Talent Platform enables organizations to harness limitless legal capability. Clients across seven countries draw on our liquid workforce of over 1,500 lawyers to do sophisticated work in a low-cost, nimble way, while our flexible employment model enables lawyers to build unique careers connected to the world’s best companies and colleagues.Our Contracts Platform enables organizations to derive new value from their commercial relationships. Many of the world’s biggest companies turn to Axiom for solutions that combine technology and services in the areas of regulatory response, M&A diligence and integration, clinical trial acceleration, contract data extraction, and contract negotiation. As the first Axiomite fully dedicated to market and competitive intelligence, you will identify opportunities for growth and development, evolve our strategy, and develop our voice. You will build the intellectual frameworks and operational infrastructure necessary to make you an outstanding individual contributor and to help Axiom stay one step ahead in a continuously changing world.  You will join a new Product Development function, tasked with building products that create value and delightful experiences for our clients and lawyers, enable scale, and drive growth.  Specifically, in this role you will: Frame, monitor and report on broad industry and technology developments, including legal business models, the gig economy, blockchain, smart contracts, artificial intelligenceFrame, monitor and report on competitive and partner landscapes within legal services and technology; map competitor and partner offerings to identify white spaces vs. areas of robust activityDerive and advise on implications for Product and Commercial strategyBuild scalable infrastructure for collecting, disseminating, and maintaining data and insights connected to market and competitive intelligenceInform relevant teams when competitors and partners introduce new deals, features, or capabilities, including recommendations for senior leadership where appropriateSupport Sales Enablement and Marketing on our market narratives, conduct win/loss analyses, and equip our Sales and Lawyer Talent teams with battle cards and other collateralDevelop and maintain a network of information sources, such as distributors, partners, clients, and industry thought leadersSurface relevant conferences and industry events, attend for research purposes, and collaborate with Product and Commercial teams to ensure Axiom has a high level of participationSupport the production of thought leadership contentSuccessful Candidates Successful candidates must be a fit for Axiom’s unique operating environment and culture: values-led, customer-centric, high-growth, innovative, and lean. As such, successful candidates must be highly capable in each of the following dimensions (among others): adaptability, curiosity, resourcefulness, analytical thinking/problem solving, proactivity, collaboration and communication, grit, technologically savvy, and operating with/through a lean team.  Beyond these characteristics, here are the required skills, knowledge, capabilities, and education: 7+ years of experience in a technology-focused B2B environment, with at least 3 years of experience in market research and intelligenceDemonstrated ability to initiate and nurture industry relationshipsDemonstrated ability to create compelling positioning and competitive analysesDemonstrated ability to listen, communicate, and present to a variety of audiences: prospects, clients, salespeople, recruiters, partners, and managementOrganizational fit for the Axiom culture and our core values of Irresistible, Fresh, Thoughtful and CommittedBachelor’s degree required; MBA preferredAccommodation for Individuals with Disabilities: Upon request and consistent with applicable laws, Axiom will attempt to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities who require an accommodation to participate in the application process. To request an accommodation to complete the application form, please contact us at benefits@axiomlaw.com and include “Applicant Accommodation” in the subject line. Read moreSee All

job_desc: One 12-month research post is offered as a joint initiative between the Centre for Science and Security Studies (CSSS), within the School of Security Studies, and the Department of Informatics. The role is intended to further research relating to the governance and politics of blockchain technologies, with a particular focus on nuclear issues. The postholder will be affiliated with both CSSS and the Department of Informatics and will benefit from exposure to a range of research activities across both groupings. This post will a fixed-term contract for 12 months (with the potential for renewal). This is full-time - 100% full time equivalent. job_desc: Content EditorJob brief Ainfin is a financial technology company based in Level39, Canary Wharf, London - the biggest fintech accelerator in Europe.  Its mission is to open the emerging markets to democratised banking, focussing on solving the fundamental problem of widespread financial exclusion of the 2.5 billion unbanked population in the world. Ainfin aims to contribute to real wealth creation amongst the poor and underprivileged.  Ainfin operates a state of the art multi-currency and multi channel digital banking platform aimed at reaching the last mile of customers in emerging markets. In the UK  Ainfin is an exciting phase of growth, leveraging the Blockchain technology to leapfrog its current digital banking operations in emerging markets into the frontier of distributed banking services. This is an exciting time in our history with a further round of fundraising. We are now looking to scale quickly, so now is a great time to join and be part of an exciting journey.  We are looking for a Content Editor to research, write, proofread and publish online content.  Content Editor responsibilities include producing the monthly newsletter, fact-checking writers articles and optimizing written pieces to increase user engagement. If you have excellent writing and editing skills in English and experience managing editorial calendars, wed like to meet you. Please share samples of your work by including either a portfolio or links to your published articles along with your application.  Ultimately, you will produce engaging quality content that speaks to our audience and boosts engagement with our brand. ResponsibilitiesWrite blog posts and marketing copy to promote our products and servicesProofread, re-structure and edit articles by content writersUpdate our website and social media pages with new contentCraft and send our monthly newsletterInterview industry professionals and use online sources to research topicsImprove illustration in collaboration with marketing and design teamsOptimize published pieces using SEO guidelinesManage the editorial calendar and ensure timely publicationGenerate new ideas around industry-related topicsMonitor web traffic and user engagement (e.g. bounce rates)RequirementsProven work experience as a Content Editor, Web Editor or similar rolePortfolio of published workExcellent writing and editing skills in EnglishAttention to detailHands-on experience with Content Management Systems (e.g. WordPress)Familiarity with SEO and keyword researchTeam spiritBSc in Marketing, Journalism, Communications or related field Read moreSee All

job_desc: MORE ABOUT THIS JOBWhat We Do At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here. What engineering solutions do we build? IBD Engineering creates and maintains engineering solutions for the Investment Banking division. We develop cutting-edge systems and processes that form the core of our key business. The applications we deliver support all aspects of advisory deal origination and execution. This includes client targeting, ideas generation, relationship management, pitching, market analytics, deal execution, book building, fund management and revenue reporting.  Team members have the opportunity to work at the forefront of technology innovation alongside industry leaders and make significant contributions to the field. Your Accountability & Impact We are looking for a creative, innovative and enthusiastic leader who will undertake JavaScript and Java development across all tiers of our business-facing systems. Your responsibilities will include: You will work with the business to Transform/Digitise/Automate end-to-end investment banking deal-related activities across different product lines – Equity/M&A/Debt, working collaboratively with other global technology teams across the firm.You will leverage Agile methodologies and be responsible for product delivery ensuring quality and meeting timelinesYou will lead by example and therefore, you will be expected to spend at least 60% of your time as a developerYou are responsible to ensure your team efficiently uses the current technology stack that includes React, Node.js, AngularJS, Typescript, Java, Mongo DB, SQL Server, Sybase etc. on Microservices architectures. We value code reviews, TDD, metrics, Quality is paramount!You will be responsible for coaching the team on the technologies mentioned above and any others which are incorporated along the wayIdeally, you love to learn! We provide free access to various learning platforms such as PluralSight, Safari Books etc. to enable you to grow into better engineers.We encourage candidates to bring new ideas and technologies to enhance the current state of the art. For e.g. reactive/event-based architectures, domain modelling, automated code generation techniques.Our goal is to foster innovation to find new ways to improve current processes and develop creative solutions through Big Data Analytics, Machine learning, Blockchain etc. We want you to be influential! RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONSBasic Qualifications7+ years relevant technical experience as a developer having a successful track-record of delivering applications2+ years Tech Lead experience using AgileExperience in Java/JavaScript (AngularJS or React etc.), Spring related technologies, RESTful services, JAX-RS(Jersey), DropWizard / Spring Boot in a test-driven environmentObject-oriented/functional programming skills. Ability to use these to understand business requirements and build sound solutionsAbility to integrate into and work well within a global teamIdeal QualificationsAutomated testingMicroservices architecturesBig Data AnalyticsMachine Learning ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHSThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world. Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2018. job_desc: Head of Data Architecture is being sought to join Electrocomponent’s exciting Innovation department. As Head of Data Architecture you will be building tools and platforms to support ambitious internal projects involving IoT, Blockchain and real-time data streams. You will be a Senior Data Architect with extensive experience of Cloud technologies like AWS, Google BigQuery, MS Azure, Bluemix experienced in transforming traditional Data Warehousing approaches to Big Data based approaches. As Head of Data Architecture you will be responsible for the strategic technical vision and execution of data tools, data engineering and data infrastructure. You will be constantly pushing the boundaries, designing and building a cutting edge data ecosystem. You will play a critical role, helping get the right ‘data design’ from the onset for all initiatives across a Global business. As Head of Data Architecture you will also lead the charge in designing and developing innovative data products to monetise.This is a unique and rare opportunity, to really shape how key data is utilised within a Global business. Whilst this role is largely strategic and business led, it is essential that you have a strong technical skill set to draw on to oversee the alignment of data architecture.Key responsibilities include:Strategic role in designing and building a scalable information assetDrive the charge in designing a scalable, flexibility modern data eco system and a range of tools for the us as a business to fully exploitProviding the blueprint design for the Data Engineering team to build solutions, productsEmbedding data architecture principles within the cultureSupporting PoCs in design to implementationThe ability to kickstart data PoCs Support the key business initiatives and influencing decisions on great ‘data by design’ Own the decision around the data tools we invest in (with business collaboration)Manage and lead a team of subject matter data architectsEstablish great working relationships and communication channels with relevant departmentsExplore & experiment with new technologies and data solutionsBuilding tools and platforms to support our ambitious internal projects involving IoT and real-time data streams.Responsible for the strategic technical vision and execution of data tools, engineering and infrastructure. Constantly pushing the boundaries in designing a cutting edge data ecosystemFocussed on constant, incremental value deliveryDriving technical and productivity excellence across your teamsBuilding and managing teams of engineers across multiple systemsMotivate and support team members to perform at their bestFacilitate and manage the professional development and learning opportunities for your team membersEssential: Data modelling experience eg star schema, 3NFCustomer and / or Product MDM experienceProficiency in Microsoft SQL Server and at least 2 other databasesPassionate about dataKnowledge of Big Data solutions including Hadoop, Spark and open source technologiesExperience in at least one of the following areas: any programming language such as Python or R, Machine Learning, Apache Hadoop, Spark, Beehive, Hue, SquirreAlways Ability to establish credibility and develop effective business relationships with colleaguesWillingness to learnStrong SQL and noSQL skills, data management knowledge Pragmatic thinkerFun to work withArticulate and strong presentation and storytelling skillsExposure to API, JSON, XML data connectionsComputer literacy in Python and JavaExposure to Agile methodologyExposure to the Cloudera, Horton Works, MapR stackExposure to Graph database solutionsCloud certified (eg AWS)aThe Company Electrocomponents trading through its brands RS Components and Allied electronics is the world’s leading high service level distributor of industrial products to engineers. It is a global business operating in 27 countries with over 1m customers. The company is listed on the London Stock Exchange FTSE 250 and in the last financial year had revenues of £2bn.Following a change of several key members of the executive leadership team in 2015, including the appointment of Alexander von Schirmeister, Chief Innovation Officer who joined from eBay, the business has been reinvigorated and there is a renewed appetite for growth and innovation. The new leadership team has developed an ambitious strategic vision that centres on driving a best-in-class customer and supplier experience, enhancing the organisation’s digital capabilities and focusing online user experience to increase the pace of change and provide a profitable base for future growth. Electrocomponents recently celebrated achieving £1 billion of annual digital revenues.Technical Team Video: https://youtu.be/e4XiZXIhW_AHow to ApplyTo apply please upload your CV and follow the instructions online. job_desc: Who are we? buzzgroup is a growing insurtech company thats already making waves. Based in Soho, but with customers from across the UK, Europe and around the world, our vision is to empower customers to share their data on their terms using the latest cutting edge technology.  At heart, were using information to improve the way people live. Currently, were building a private asset vault on the blockchain, enabling people to store, protect and manage the things they love while also offering them the worlds first truly intelligent and personalised home insurance.  Weve got a track record of rapid growth and backing from some of the worlds leading investors. Were always looking for top talent to help us realise our vision of a secure, data-empowered future. Do you have what it takes to join our team?RoleTo champion our internal research into our unique buzzvault datasetsResearch, understand and communicate learnings throughout the business to monetise the value inherent in our dataEvidence findings through the use of statistics, proof of concepts and case studiesRefine and develop the informational advantage our data provides us within the marketplaceResponsibilitiesWork closely with all parts of the business to understand the nature and processes that build up buzzvault data and actively work with the business to improve data qualityResearch and investigation into our unique dataset to produce new insights and proof of concepts that can drive us towards our business goalsResearch and report on the effects of the unique vault dataset on all parts of the insurance journey, including customer acquisition, marketing, communications, pricing and claims journey. This includes investigations into customer demographics and life-time value and helping to embed our unique buzzvault data throughout the claims handling process.Understand the nature of our existing external data sources and how they can be used, investigate new sources and actively improve mapping of external data into our databases.Investigate market trends and help with premium analysis and competitor analysis to keep our business at the forefront of our industryCreate, maintain and deliver clear and useful reports to the wider businessHorizon scan to keep up-to-date with latest technology, techniques and methodsStay ever-curious, challenge assumptions and search for evidence of a better way!Good to haveExperience with Machine Learning techniques (classification, regressions, feature selection etc.)Good knowledge in a scripting languageExperience in financial or insurance businessPersonal AttributesHighly numerate and expert in stats/ scientific methodologiesCurious, self-starting, keen to improve processes rather than just followCollaborative - would be keen to understand data gathering and realise insight from investigationsKeen to pursue investigations all the way to solutionsPerksVitality Private Medical InsuranceSimplyhealth Cash PlanMonthly Sanctus 1:1 Personal Coaching£500 annual credit towards learningMagical self-replenishing fridge full of soft drinks and organic fruitDeliveroo if working lateMonthly team socials (activity focused, not just boozy)Monthly team lunchesBirthday Amazon gift voucherTop notch coffeeVR gaming equipmentWeekly yoga classes buzzmove is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. job_desc: We're looking for a Lead Software Engineer to be responsible for the data platform team and develop the data engineering platform, which supports our applications and partners. This is a full-time position, based in London but with global scope working with smart, committed people in data, software, infrastructure, and other key disciplines for advertising technology.  Our systems generate a vast amount of data, approximately 350GB per hour, distributed over many servers. We have a data ecosystem based on tools including Scala, Spark, Cassandra, Redshift, Druid, Redis and Postgres that allows us to retrieve, process, merge, compare and warehouse data for intensive analysis. Once centralised, the data is used to generate complex reports and insight. About YouYou are self-motivated with experience of solving complex large-scale data scalability challenges, as part of a highly-qualified team.You will have five years commercial software experience, preferably in media/advertising technology.You have two or more years in a management role, preferably in media/advertising technology.You are an excellent communicator and mentor with strong decision-making skills and can explain complex problems clearly and concisely.You will find new and interesting ways to use our data to improve the potential value; we see our data as our future.You will be responsible for the evolution of our data platform, developing the architecture and maintaining the data platform backlog.RequiredExperience working with and leading teams.An excellent understanding of Java with aptitude to pick up Scala (bonus if you have experience here already) language skills.Intermediate/advanced knowledge of data structures and algorithms.Experience handling large data sets, ideally with Apache Spark.Excellent knowledge of cloud based services (Amazon Web Services a plus).Excellent knowledge of working with relational data storage and one or more non relational data stores - key/value, columnar, document based (Redshift, Cassandra a plus).Excellent working understanding of Linux on the server-side, profiling, debugging JVM based apps.Experience integrating and consuming data from third party API's.Experience of building API’s (REST primarily) for data consumption by internal applications and trusted third parties.Desirable:Advanced knowledge and experience of using AWS components (EC2/ECS, S3, RDS, EMR) to solve data centric problems.Experience with functional programming is a plus.Experience with data processing pipelines using Luigi and Airflow.Knowledge of blockchain technology.Understanding of Big O notation, algorithms, data structures and performance analysis.Knowledge of Python scripting, automation with Salt/Ansible a plus.Performance analysis of JVM technology.PostgreSQL (or MySQL) with advanced techniques such as partitioning and indexing.What Blis Can OfferOpportunity to work for a market leader in the digital advertising space, working with groundbreaking technology to develop custom solutions to problems in a new industry.Innovative, open and friendly culture.Great office in central London, based in Holborn.Beer Friday - to help see in the weekend.Free breakfast.Blis bank-holiday - An extra bank-holiday courtesy of Blis.Free eye tests.Casual dress - No suits required, unless of course you like them!Fresh Fruits.Childcare vouchers.Cycle scheme.Day off on your birthday!Flexible working hours - job_desc: Are you a Technical Lead with experience across Node.js, React.js and Redux? We have a greenfield opportunity where you will build, train, and lead a London based tech team as well as enable clients to build on their platform. This global business have created an enterprise-grade private blockchain development platform, offering blockchain solutions to businesses across multiple industries, working with some of the world's largest institutions.  This is an amazing opportunity as you'll be joining the business just as they're looking to scale up, meaning the chance to progress in your career will be huge! You'll need to be committed and driven, personally aiming high and always wanting better. We're looking for motivated experts who are self-motivated and willing to think outside your comfort zone to create solutions from nothing Your responsibilities will include: - Becoming a subject matter expert, capable of scoping, sizing and building out new applications running on the platform Developing training material and provide training to the technical teamsManaging relationships with Clients/Partners on an ongoing basis; ensuring they're provided with sufficient training and support to deliver projectsTo work with external 3rd party developers in the development of new applications as well as working as a senior technical engineer within internal teamsSkills and Experience Required:2+ years' experience leading a team of at least 5 developersJavaScriptNode.jsReact.jsRedux In addition to these, you will ideally have some experience with integration development, front-end development and functional programming generally. No experience with blockchains is required. You will also be:A self-starter, ability to prioritise tasks and manage your own time effectivelyPassionate about delivering quality support, with an attention to detailAble to work under pressure to tight timelines and with little guidance A very competitive salary is on offer alongside share options. If you're ticking most of the boxes above and would like to find out a little bit more, please get in touch today by calling Rachel on 0117 910 3333 or emailing r . rickard @ computerfutures . com. job_desc: Head of Data Architecture is being sought to join Electrocomponent’s exciting Innovation department. As Head of Data Architecture you will be building tools and platforms to support ambitious internal projects involving IoT, Blockchain and real-time data streams. You will be a Senior Data Architect with extensive experience of Cloud technologies like AWS, Google BigQuery, MS Azure, Bluemix experienced in transforming traditional Data Warehousing approaches to Big Data based approaches. As Head of Data Architecture you will be responsible for the strategic technical vision and execution of data tools, data engineering and data infrastructure. You will be constantly pushing the boundaries, designing and building a cutting edge data ecosystem. You will play a critical role, helping get the right ‘data design’ from the onset for all initiatives across a Global business. As Head of Data Architecture you will also lead the charge in designing and developing innovative data products to monetise.This is a unique and rare opportunity, to really shape how key data is utilised within a Global business. Whilst this role is largely strategic and business led, it is essential that you have a strong technical skill set to draw on to oversee the alignment of data architecture.Key responsibilities include:Strategic role in designing and building a scalable information assetDrive the charge in designing a scalable, flexibility modern data eco system and a range of tools for the us as a business to fully exploitProviding the blueprint design for the Data Engineering team to build solutions, productsEmbedding data architecture principles within the cultureSupporting PoCs in design to implementationThe ability to kickstart data PoCs Support the key business initiatives and influencing decisions on great ‘data by design’ Own the decision around the data tools we invest in (with business collaboration)Manage and lead a team of subject matter data architectsEstablish great working relationships and communication channels with relevant departmentsExplore & experiment with new technologies and data solutionsBuilding tools and platforms to support our ambitious internal projects involving IoT and real-time data streams.Responsible for the strategic technical vision and execution of data tools, engineering and infrastructure. Constantly pushing the boundaries in designing a cutting edge data ecosystemFocussed on constant, incremental value deliveryDriving technical and productivity excellence across your teamsBuilding and managing teams of engineers across multiple systemsMotivate and support team members to perform at their bestFacilitate and manage the professional development and learning opportunities for your team membersEssential: Data modelling experience eg star schema, 3NFCustomer and / or Product MDM experienceProficiency in Microsoft SQL Server and at least 2 other databasesPassionate about dataKnowledge of Big Data solutions including Hadoop, Spark and open source technologiesExperience in at least one of the following areas: any programming language such as Python or R, Machine Learning, Apache Hadoop, Spark, Beehive, Hue, SquirreAlways Ability to establish credibility and develop effective business relationships with colleaguesWillingness to learnStrong SQL and noSQL skills, data management knowledge Pragmatic thinkerFun to work withArticulate and strong presentation and storytelling skillsExposure to API, JSON, XML data connectionsComputer literacy in Python and JavaExposure to Agile methodologyExposure to the Cloudera, Horton Works, MapR stackExposure to Graph database solutionsCloud certified (eg AWS)aThe Company Electrocomponents trading through its brands RS Components and Allied electronics is the world’s leading high service level distributor of industrial products to engineers. It is a global business operating in 27 countries with over 1m customers. The company is listed on the London Stock Exchange FTSE 250 and in the last financial year had revenues of £2bn.Following a change of several key members of the executive leadership team in 2015, including the appointment of Alexander von Schirmeister, Chief Innovation Officer who joined from eBay, the business has been reinvigorated and there is a renewed appetite for growth and innovation. The new leadership team has developed an ambitious strategic vision that centres on driving a best-in-class customer and supplier experience, enhancing the organisation’s digital capabilities and focusing online user experience to increase the pace of change and provide a profitable base for future growth. Electrocomponents recently celebrated achieving £1 billion of annual digital revenues.Technical Team Video: https://youtu.be/e4XiZXIhW_AHow to ApplyTo apply please upload your CV and follow the instructions online. If you experience any difficulties or require further details, please contact Recruitment Team on 44 (0) 207 842 2968Leroy Nimley, Technical RecruiterEmail: leroy.nimley@rs-components.comLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/leroynimley.For further information, please visit:Corporate Website: http://www.electrocomponents.com/2015 Annual Report: http://www.electrocomponents.com/~/media/Files/E/ElectroComponents/documents/reports-presentations/reports/Electrocomponents-Annual-Report-2015.pdf Read moreSee All

job_desc: An outstanding Director, Financial Services at frog draws from deep financial industry expertise to help craft and articulate the overall design strategy for innovative products and services for our financial services clients. You have a strong foundation in well-established financial services models but a keen interest in the future experiences designed in a rapidly transforming industry. You likely come from a design or strategy background.  Areas that you might be deeply experienced in or passionate about might include: the future of commerce, trust and trade; entrepreneurial challengers and disruptors in a historically slow-moving industry; new business models e.g. in the sharing economy, crowd-funding, etc.; the future of blockchain, cryptocurrencies and AI, and/or; the future of payments.  Your responsibility will be to partner across frog to drive new opportunities in financial services and, most importantly, lead and contribute to client programs in all stages of the engagement life cycle -- envisioning new solutions, validating markets, modeling business opportunities and defining requirements, system architecture, design, implementation, or support strategies. In some phases, you may be a primary driver of the engagement and in other phases, you may be a key contributor to frog’s multidisciplinary team.  Working at frog as a member of the Financial Services practice means working with a world class team who represent the frog disciplines of creative, strategy, and technology. If you are looking for a thoughtful, inspiring environment where you get a chance to help drive innovation for the connected world, then frog is the place for you. The Contribution: A Financial Services director fills a vital role, applying a Financial Services-industry lens to growth strategy, cx design, org activation, product and service design, and delivery.  This often means developing an understanding of the market and competitive factors, enabling technologies, identifying and prioritizing opportunities, and helping to frame the overarching context of a project.  The job of the Financial Service Director is to ensure that the team delivers not only designs, but also technology and business insights that help clients make sound decisions about their business. Client engagements can range from 30 days to multi-months, and might challenge you in the following areas:  Demonstrate domain knowledge and expertise in Financial Services including challenges and opportunities in the space  Work with all members of the frog disciplines within project teams including: strategy, creative, and technology.  Develop an understanding of the client’s business environment, strategy, and technology capabilities  Master foundational consulting skills, including expertise in design methods and frameworks, and knowing when to use the right tools and approaches to use in solving client problems  Expand your domain knowledge and expertise in communicating business strategy including business model development, financial modeling, product portfolio planning, organizational strategy, channel and go-to-market models etc.  Build your personal brand and expand frog’s Financial Services practice thought leadership through activities such as publishing articles on the frog blog, and speaking at conferences  Contribute to business development  Scope and manage consulting engagements  Lead client engagements on a day-to-day basis  Lead executive / expert interviews and client presentations  You will be expected to mentor colleagues with respect to your craft within projects and within the organization at large  Be willing to travel when necessary to meet client engagements You Are: Someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. You bring to the organization the following competencies;  5+ years in the Financial Services space  A track record on teams building transformative solutions for Financial Services clients  Successfully led project teams to deliver products or for client facing engagements  Flexed your communication and writing skills to craft stories in the context of public speaking, business presentations, or investment pitches  Have worked as a consultant and understand how to manage client expectations from pre-sales through final deliverables Read moreSee All

job_desc: The candidate will be responsible in the first instance, and under supervision, for developing a road map and business case for the enhancement and development of KBR procurement systems. Following the approval of the roadmap the candidate will be responsible for delivering, or assisting to deliver this road map.  It is anticipated that the development of this road map will produce a combination of enhancements to existing systems and configuration of new systems. The candidate will take ownership for ensuring that our systems and developed and configured in such a manner that deliver relevant information and data analysis to support future decision making. Knowledge of some of the following technologies will be a requirement: Oracle databasesSharePointSQL development 2. Qualifications, Experience and SkillsKBR is transforming the way in which procurement and supply chain information is managed and used. The aim is to deliver state-of-the-art capabilities that provide KBR with market intelligence, more effective and efficient supply chain management whilst minimising and automating transactional activities.  KBR have a suite of in-house and commercial systems that assist us in delivering our supply chain management. Our aim is twofold: to enhance our current systems by embedding and supplementing them with current and emerging technologies; and to maximise the market intelligence and sue of these technologies. The objective is to deliver the best information to enable optimal business decisions and to minimise the cost of transactional and non-added value activities.  We are looking for a candidate demonstrable relevant experience in current and emerging technologies and their configuration and implementation in business environment. The technologies that KBR current utilise include: Oracle databasesSharePointDevelopment of systems interfacesBusiness reporting tools such as SSRS The candidate must be proficient in the configuration and management of these technologies or be able to demonstrate that he/she will be able to master them in a reasonably short period of time. Furthermore the candidate must have knowledge and reasonable experience in data structure and data mining.  Some of the emerging technologies that KBR is looking at implementing include: Robotic process automationBlockchainMobile applicationsSpeech recognition Knowledge and experience in some of these technologies will be an advantage. Preference will be given to the individual who displays the necessary professional and personal skills to successfully integrate and produce high-calibre delivery of analytics and systems deployments as a team member in a small multi-discipline team.  The applicant will be required to demonstrate a suitable blend of appropriate education, experience and personal competencies as outlined below:  Knowledge of Procurement and system activities in a Project environment  Flexibility with a proactive attitude and willingness to get the job done  · Good communication skills  · A very high reliance on self-sufficiency, motivation, self prioritising and good planning due to the nature of the job (places and times).  · Enthusiasm Read moreSee All

job_desc: Engineering LeadHave you always wanted to work in a dynamic, fast moving startup, but were put off by the associated risk? At BCG Digital Ventures we launch a new business every month and we have the backing of one of the worlds leading consultancy firms: the Boston Consulting Group. We combine BCGs resources and domain expertise with our diverse, global team of accomplished designers, engineers, product experts and business strategists to launch ventures in many different industries, incorporating groundbreaking technologies such as blockchain or machine learning. All of us are entrepreneurs at heart, seeking to move quickly and nimbly in order to find new ways of delivering value to our customers.An Engineering Lead performs the role of CTO on one of our ventures. You are responsible for the technical direction and delivery of the products and businesses we build. This includes everything from hiring and technical architecture, through to pitching for initial funding. You will work closely with our other cohorts such as product and design to ensure the team is focussed on doing the right thing, at the right time, in the right way. We believe in and practice servant leadership here, so your prime goal is to bring the best out of the other talented technologists on your venture team, not to do it all yourself.What you'll get to do· Grow innovative, groundbreaking products and business that address real customer frictions· Learn how to found, grow and operate successful startups· Design and architect innovative, modern architectures· Build, support and mentor effective teams· Write code alongside your development team· Champion a focus on software qualities such as testability, security, scalability, operability etc· Work with state of the art technologies to solve genuine, real-world problems· Champion good agile practices that provide a foundation for iterative product development· Build strong relationships with product managers, venture architects and designers· Enjoy working in a diverse, dynamic, collaborative, transparent, environment where everyone's ideas and opinions are equally valued· Cross-pollinate good practises and insights between multiple ventures to drive continuous improvement of the DV London Engineering cohortWhat youll bring· Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies· Real passion for solving customer frictions through simple and effective software· Experience with architectural design whilst leading and inspiring software development teams· Strong people skills that contribute to an open and collaborative environment· Experience working with Agile, Lean and Continuous Delivery approaches, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, Infrastructure as Code etc.· Experience in communicating technical vision to a variety of team members· Experience building cloud native software architectures· An ability to embrace and reduce uncertainty through continual validated learningAbout BCGDVBCG Digital Ventures is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. To learn more, visit us at www.bcgdv.com Read moreSee All

job_desc: Job ID 25809BR  Job Title Solutions Architect  Country United Kingdom  Location BelfastLeedsLondonManchester Local Specialism Consulting - Technology  Line of Service Consulting  Industry Technology and digital  Position Type Full Time  Contract Type Permanent  Job Description Who we are looking forAt PwC you’ll get to work with the largest, most recognisable clients in the world.We are rapidly building out our team of digital product delivery specialists and we are looking for individuals who will play a key role in achieving our mission of helping clients thrive in the digital age.We're looking for people who will think outside the box, not settling for the status quo and who will look to create impact from day one.About the roleAs a Solutions Architect within PwC you will form an integral part in the delivery of digital solutions to enforce and drive our digital strategy, all the while - meeting the needs of our clients. In PwC’s agile delivery team, you will be architecting solutions, which keep our clients at the forefront of digital technologies and ahead of their competitors. You will utilise best practices such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Test-Driven Development and peer reviews, and be involved in end-to-end software delivery.A Solutions Architect will be able to lead several teams of engineers, setting technical direction, architecting, building and overseeing technical solutions to meet business requirements, adhering to high coding standards and engineering principles. You would typically have technical ownership across a set of products, perhaps specialising in one or more areas. In addition, you would liaise with business stakeholders, providing guidance, architectural overview and technical strategy.Some level of travel will be required for this role. Requirements The Solutions Architect should have experience of:Architecting and over-seeing N-tier solutions,Contributing to and leading application designEnd-to-end involvement in software deliveryDemonstrating OO development in a commercial environmentTechnical ownership of one or more productsA range of software delivery tools (source control, agile tools, CI, IDE etc)Implementing and following best practicesEffective prioritisation of tasks and personal time managementWorking with team around producing estimatesDemonstrating initiativeCoaching and mentoring more junior team members both technically and professionallyInteracting with clients, product owners and senior executivesDesirable experience:Degree in computer science related disciplineDelivering in a highly collaborative agile environmentUnderstanding of blockchain technologiesBehavioural Driven Development and Exploratory TestingCloud environment experienceMicroservices architecture practical knowledge About Us About PwCWe’re one of the world’s leading professional services organisations. From 158 countries, we help our clients, some of the most successful organisations on the globe, as well as its most dynamic entrepreneurs and thriving private businesses, to create the value they want. We help to measure, protect and enhance the things that matter most to them.ConsultingIn Consulting we deliver practical, far-sighted advice that gets straight to the heart of clients’ business issues and delivers amazing results by helping our clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent or fundamentally change the way they do business, the work you do will be all about helping organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster. You could find yourself working with household names in a diverse range of industries – everyone from big-name broadcasters and high-street banks to multinational telecoms operators and energy companies.The skills we look for in future employeesAll our people need to demonstrate the skills and behaviours that support us in delivering our business strategy. This is important to the work we do for our business, and our clients. These skills and behaviours make up our global leadership framework, ‘The PwC Professional’ and are made up of five core attributes; whole leadership, technical capabilities, business acumen, global acumen and relationships.Learn more here www.pwc.com/uk/careers/experienced/applyDiversityWe work in a changing world which offers great opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool, as well as those who reflect the diverse nature of our society. And we aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. Creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business and as an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we're open to flexible working arrangements where appropriate.Learn more here www.pwc.com/uk/diversity Read moreSee All

job_desc: TokenCard is a cutting-edge technology company that is shaping the future of banking by building decentralised payment solutions on the Ethereum Network. As the cryptocurrency market continues to grow and outpace traditional asset classes, there is a need to provide products and services to benefit its growing user-base. One such product is the TokenCard debit card.  The Engineering team is a fast-growing group of talented people expanding in size to match the multiple challenges associated with scaling a global payment solution. TokenCard is looking for a Backend Engineer focused on the delivery of our highly-performant, mission-critical backend software that bridges the gap between our systems and the Ethereum Network.  Our ideal candidate puts users and product features first, is technically-minded, creative, and passionate about elegant software design:  RESPONSIBILITIES Ensuring the technical feasibility of product requirementsWork with the product to iterate on the design and implementation of our productsWork with the other backend engineers to deliver TokenCard’s core platformParticipate in both design and code reviewsProviding accurate timing estimates on workCollaborate internal stakeholders to build uncharted, decentralised solutions to the payments industryRequirements Must have Experience in building backend systems in a service oriented architecture on the cloudAbility to architect scalable solutions in a fast-paced environmentProgramming experience with GoExperience in profiling and debugging Go systemsAbility to carefully break down problems into smaller piecesExcellent communication skills Nice to have Experience building highly-concurrent distributed systemsExperience / understanding of Ethereum / other blockchainsExperience using GCPExperience to the development of Smart Contracts in SolidityBenefitsCompetitive salary25 days holiday allowanceQuarterly team eventsFriday catch-ups – beers, wine, soft drinks and snacks providedWednesday team lunchFlexible working arrangementsCool location in Central LondonWork on the latest technologyYour choice of top of the range hardware Read moreSee All
