job_desc: Your RoleAre you an effective challenger? Do you know how to maintain independence and objectivity? Do you have deep understanding of technology, SDLC and cyber risk management?  This Director level Technology Risk Controller Role is functionally aligned to the Chief Technology Office (CTO) function. We are looking for someone who can: Provide sound subject matter advice and challenge across the full range of risk management lifecycle activities relating to the Bank's technology and cyber taxonomies. This includes risk identification, assessment, and oversight of remediation planning and execution; participation and challenge of IT risk related activities.Attend and actively participate in technology function / regional operational risk forums, understand and challenge technology related issues and actions relating to how Technology manages it risks and controls as well as its critical IT processes which support the business.Support wider team objectives and contribute to deliverables such as providing input to the annual risk taxonomy review, delivering well written thematic risk reviews identifying forward looking risks and acting as a reviewer of technical risk assessments covering the functional area.Understand regulatory and audit expectations and find the best ways to ensure we deliver.Make use of relevant data and analytics techniques and metrics and possess an understanding of emerging technologies to support risk assessment and identification activities.Build strong relationships with Senior C&ORC, IT and Business stakeholders (including Legal, Compliance, HR, Technology, Group Information Security Office, BCM and Audit functions).Your teamYou’ll be reporting into the Compliance & Operational Risk Control (C&ORC) Technology Risk Controller for CTO (Chief Technology Office). We are part of the Corporate Centre Risk Control function (CCRC) within C&ORC and provide oversight of technology, information / cyber security, outsourcing, Business Continuity Management and program management risks across the UBS Group.Your experience and skillsYou have:Solid experience of working in the financial sector, having conducted first or second line of defense technology risk workExposure to Technology Risk frameworks and governance methods plus in depth knowledge of information security technology, software development methods / SDLC and cyber;You have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or relevant discipline; plus a professional qualification (e.g. CISSP, CISM, CISA, CRISC) ; or hands-on experience with industry accepted IT Control frameworks (e.g. ISO 17799 / COSO / COBIT) is an advantage.Given the subject matter that will be covered within CTO, the ideal candidate will preferably have a solid understanding of new and emerging technologies, including:Robotics / AIBlockchainCloud / XAASFintechInnovationAgile / Dev OpsSome experience in conducting Data Analytics using tools such as Tableau.You are:An experienced Technology Risk Manager in IT Risk / IT Audit or a similar subject-matter area;A person with initiative that can develop plans, manage projects and execute risk assessments;Analytic, with the ability to provide practical solutions for minimizing risk;Results oriented and assertive (you don’t shy away from challenging situations);A person with a solid technical and background, with an understanding of software development practices and cyber related risk;Able to communicate with different levels of seniority and translate technical issues into business languageWhat we offerTogether. That’s how we do things. We offer people around the world a supportive, challenging and diverse working environment. We value your passion and commitment, and reward your performance. Keen to achieve the work-life agility that you desire? We're open to discussing how this could work for you (and us).Take the next stepAre you truly collaborative? Succeeding at UBS means respecting, understanding and trusting colleagues and clients. Challenging others and being challenged in return. Being passionate about what you do. Driving yourself forward, always wanting to do things the right way. Does that sound like you? Then you have the right stuff to join us. Apply now.Disclaimer / Policy StatementsUBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Read moreSee All

job_desc: TokenCard is a London based cutting-edge technology company that is shaping the future of finance by building decentralised payment and transaction solutions on the Ethereum blockchain. As the cryptocurrency market continues to grow and outpace traditional asset classes, there is a need to provide products and services to benefit its growing user base. One product is the TokenCard prepaid debit card.  We’re looking for an operations rock star to run our prepaid card program. You will own the entire operational journey from transaction authorisations all the way to settlement via fraud and reconciliations. As part of this role you are expected to bring your past experience to the table to help shape a successful prepaid card program. Eventually you will recruit a small team to support you and split out functions. This is an opportunity for a card operations specialist to take the next step in their career. RESPONSIBILITIESManage relationship with our card program manager, card issuer and schemeKey stakeholder for the business on all card related mattersCoordinate the work of finance team, treasury and customer service to ensure operational excellenceDesign and improve processes surrounding our card programMonitor inbound customer queries to understand where our program can improveCreate processes to manage risk and fraud related to the card programCarry out full investigations when things don’t go as expected and produce action plansRecruit and train a team of operation associates as our customer base growsRequirementsExperience working for an organisation with an active consumer facing prepaid card programYou are the expert about all things card in your current organisationExperience handling chargebacks, reconciliations issues and card fraudExperience managing a small team preferredExcellent written and spoken EnglishExperience in fintech startup preferredGraduate level educationBenefitsCompetitive salary25 days holiday allowanceQuarterly team eventsFriday catch-ups – beers, wine, soft drinks and snacks providedWednesday team lunchFlexible working arrangementsCool location in Central LondonWork on the latest technologyYour choice of top of the range hardware Read moreSee All

job_desc: Application Closing Date: Thursday, 17 May 2018Build your career in Cyber Security with Edinburgh Napier UniversityWith over 50 academics, 1100 students, professional accreditation from the British Computer Society and some of the most impressive computing lab facilities in a UK university, the School of Computing is highly regarded and one of the UK's largest computing departments at the heart of Scotland's inspiring capital.The School is organised around three focus areas: Software Engineering, Cyber Security and Networking, and Creative and Social Informatics. This post is within the Cyber Security and Networking group, which has a long and widely recognised track record in research and teaching in cyber security. The School is successful in research across cyber security, network security, digital forensics and cybercrime, with strong links to the security industry and law enforcement. It also has a range of courses across this domain, including a GCHQ certified MSc, and hosts the Cyber Academy, a highly regarded focal point for knowledge exchange. Currently the School is setting up an Advanced Blockchain Identity Lab, and a training Security Operations Centre (SOCLAB). has around 18,500 students studying across our three campuses in Edinburgh and through transnational education overseas. We also have an international community with students from more than 100 countries and over 1,500 staff. We not only offer a competitive salary but also an attractive pension and a minimum of 46 days holiday per annum.Further information on the University including facts and figures can be found.The RoleThis is an exciting opportunity to join a prestigious and rapidly expanding centre for teaching and research into cyber security. The successful candidate will bring their expertise in cyber security, network security or digital forensics to join the team and take part in lecturing and research.We have an interest in applicants for an Associate Professorship. Such applicants would have a strong track record in research publications, an emerging track record in income generation and research grants, as well as enthusiasm for enhancing our teaching in the area of cyber security and networking. Interests in related emerging areas are also encouraged. The subject group is currently engaged in a range of research interests, including machine learning/data science applied to cyber security, network security, Blockchain, cryptography, e-health, malware, forensics, incident response, and virtualisation. As an Associate Professor you would also be providing leadership to lecturing staff to build research capacity including increased publication quality and research income generation.If you would like to know more about this exciting opportunity please click to view the role profile.Who We Are Looking ForApplicants must demonstrate:A doctoral level qualification in the relevant discipline.Evidence of a professional academic and research profile alongside a commitment to sustained continuous professional/academic development.Sufficient breadth and depth of experience in cyber security to develop high quality teaching/learning and research programmes. Demonstrable evidence of a teaching specialisation. Demonstrate a level of achievement appropriate to the post being applied for, including international/ national standing, research track record of high quality outputs, external income generation, and academic leadership.Benefits We OfferAssociate Professor, Grade 7 - GBP 49,149 - GBP 56,950 per annumFurther information about our benefits can be found .Additional InformationStart date is negotiable.Application Closing Date: Thursday, 17 May 2018Edinburgh Napier University is committed to supporting equality in the workplace and encourages diversity. We currently hold a bronze Athena SWAN institutional award and the School of Computing holds a Departmental Bronze Award.Apply Read moreSee All

As a Professor you would also be providing leadership to Associate Professors and Lecturing staff to enable them to increase publications rates and quality, as well as enhancing their income generation and grant applications.If you would like to know more about this exciting opportunity please click to view the role profile.Who We Are Looking ForApplicants must demonstrate:A doctoral level qualification in the relevant discipline.Evidence of a professional academic and research profile alongside a commitment to sustained continuous professional/academic development.Sufficient breadth and depth of experience in cyber security to develop high quality teaching/learning and research programmes. Demonstrable evidence of a subject leadership in the field. Demonstrate a level of achievement appropriate to the post being applied for, including international standing, a sustained research track record of high quality outputs, significant external income generation, and sustained academic leadership within a relevant discipline.Benefits We OfferGrade 8 - GBP 62,217 - GBP 70,910 per annumGrade 9 - GBP 68,849 - GBP 84,637 per annum Further information about our benefits can be found.Additional InformationStart date is negotiable.Application Closing Date: Thursday, 17 May 2018 Edinburgh Napier University is committed to supporting equality in the workplace and encourages diversity. company_info: [('Headquarters', 'New York, NY'), ('Size', '10000+ employees'), ('Founded', '1850'), ('Type', 'Company - Private'), ('Industry', 'Accounting & Legal'), ('Revenue', '$10+ billion (USD) per year'), ('Competitors', 'EY, PwC, McKinsey & Company')]
job_desc: What impact will you make? The OpportunityWe are growing our team at the Deloitte Digital Belfast Studio to enable us to build greater digital solutions for our clients. We've been doing this for a while now and we've got pretty good at it. However, we're always looking for better and more fun ways to do things. Here are just some of the tools and techniques we're using at the moment:Kanban and no-estimates Behavior Driven Development A DevOps approach to build and continuous deployment Elastic Cloud Based Environments and Architectures Rapid Prototyping ToolsWe also continually look to explore new frameworks and design patterns that help us deliver solutions that excite our client's customers and allow us to deliver at incredible speeds. There are far too many to mention and we aspire to use the latest technologies and methodologies to deliver a broad range of high quality reactive software for this decade and the next. Some of the areas we are looking at currently are:Reactive Design Native and Hybrid Mobile App Development Alternative JVM Languages and frameworks Web Components Micro-services and cloud native design Container based architecture Blockchain platformsRole descriptionYou’ll be responsible for developing cutting-edge digital solutions. You'll have the chance to work with some of the best Developers, UX Designers and Strategy thinkers in the business, delivering world class digital solutions for some of the biggest and best companies in the world. For us, developers are not people who are locked in a room to churn out code to match a large paper based specification. They need to work alongside our clients and their customers and combine deep technical expertise with innovative thinking and a strong understanding of what makes businesses and their customers tick. It's the combination of these skills and ways of working that helps us deliver the best digital experiences.We pride ourselves on our quality and speed of delivery and you'll get to work with and learn some of latest technologies, tools and techniques that allow us to continually deliver benefits to our clients.LocationBased in our studio in the Gasworks, we focus on developing cool and disruptive Web and Mobile solutions for our clients, some of the biggest brands in the UK. There's a really good team here and the craic is pretty good, it's fun, and we get to play with the latest technology. You will also have a chance to work with clients throughout Europe and beyond.HoursThis is a permanent role. We encourage careful consideration of agile ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is interesting as a permanent role with a degree of flexibility please do discuss with us.ResponsibilitiesCollaboratively working as part of a multi-disciplined feature team to design and implement software solutions to client challenges; Mentoring and supporting of junior team members to assist in their development; Owning the Technical design and delivery of bespoke solutions; Continually research new technologies to improve the way we workRequirementsStrong knowledge of Java/JVM based development practices;Experience of build and test automation preferably including continuous delivery;Familiarity with both MVC and RESTful based web applications;Understanding of modern Java build tools such as Maven or Gradle;Significant experience of modern software development methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban;Experience in micro-service development tooling such as Docker or Spring Boot. You are here: Deloitte Digital, ConsultingPart Business. Part Creative. Part Technology. One hundred per cent digital.We’re a new type of creative digital consultancy that fuses strategy, tech and design to identify where businesses need to be, then get them there. Fast.Through our studios spread across the globe, we help our clients imagine, deliver and run the future, through from customer research right through to implementation. And we love doing it.As part of our team, you’ll work side by side with strategists, designers, researchers, engineers, writers, architects and product specialists – using your unique skills and perspective to help drive transformation from operational level to the C-suite, across a complete range of digital channels.We believe in our people, which means giving them the support they need to get the best balance of work and life. Individuality, flexibility, diversity are things we’re passionate about. We wouldn’t be Deloitte Digital without it.As part of our Consulting practice, your career with Deloitte Digital can take multiple paths. We will work closely with you on a career plan that fits your skills, talents and aspirations, and provide an open environment to discuss your development and progression with Deloitte.About DeloitteOur Purpose & StrategyTo make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.How will this role make an impact that matters with Deloitte?Forecast and change the landscape of cyberspace, support clients to survive and prosper in this disruptive and ever increasingly digital age, while you support talented and more junior colleagues and impact the communities you operate within.What do we do?Deloitte offers Global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.What do we value?At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements. Hear from some of our people already working at Deloitte in agile ways. We are proud to have received a Best for All Stages of Motherhood special award in 2016 as a Top Employer for Working Families. Read moreSee All
job_title: Deloitte Digital, Senior Java Developer, Belfast

job_desc: Role descriptionHave you delivered complex technology solutions incorporating cloud technology or significant application integration? Do you have experience of working in complex Enterprise environments? Do you want to make an impact that matters and help diverse organisations along their cloud adoption path? Do you want to take the lead in developing innovative cloud and integration architectures? Do you like variety and fast pace environments?Cloud Technology presents exciting and disruptive opportunities for both our clients and ourselves. We are looking for people to join our Architecture & Integration (A&I) team who embrace change and bring us ever greater breadth and depth of expertise. Become part of a team of innovative experienced technologists who are keen to apply their knowledge in solving some of the most complex business challenges facing our clients at the nexus between business and technology.Working at the heart of some of the most significant technology transformation projects in the UK and Europe, our growing Architecture & Integration team comprises over sixty practitioners who are integral to the delivery of our client projects. Working with other colleagues from within the Technology competency and across Deloitte's Consulting Service Line as a whole, these teams provide the bridge between business and technology, advising and delivering technology-enabled business transformations.LocationLondonHoursThis is a permanent role. We encourage careful consideration of agile ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is interesting as a permanent role with a degree of flexibility please do discuss with us.ResponsibilitiesYour role will focus on providing expert advice and the management and delivery of client engagements. You will have responsibilities for:Delivering technology architecture advice to our clients, identifying solutions to their issues as appropriateSupporting our clients to align their technology strategy, including cloud, with the business strategyBecome the link between business needs and technology by understanding cloud technologies and vendors, as well as the industries in which our clients operatePerforming and supporting activities on cloud delivery engagementsSupporting the continued growth of our business through contributing to propositions, training, marketing, communications and recruitment activitiesRequirementsWe are looking for candidates who are able to demonstrate skills and experience in some of the following:Cloud and integration technologiesShaping and delivering technology-enabled transformation programmesAssessment of an organisation’s IT landscape and development of technology investment cases and roadmaps that align with business goalsExperience in aligning an organisation’s IT strategy with its overall business strategy and goalsAssessment, definition and execution of an organisation’s Enterprise Architecture functionsAn understanding of emerging and innovative technologies, such as Cloud, AI, Machine Learning, Blockchain and how to shape IT strategy and delivery in order to leverage those technologiesAnalysis, assurance and definition of solution architectures for technology programmesExperience of options analysis and supporting technical decision-making across complex technology landscapeArchitectural governance in agile technology transformation deliveryCommitment to travel to client locations and the right to live and work in the UKAdditional desirable experience includes:Working towards certification in established Cloud technologies (e.g. Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform)Familiarity with industry-recognised methodologies (e.g. Agile, CMMI, Lean, TOGAF and ITIL)Delivery of complex application integration solutions including knowledge of integration architectures, patterns and technologies such as Dell Boomi or MuleSoft’s Mule ESBSome hands-on experience of cloud, integration, app configuration or app developmentRelevant experience – either consulting or in one or more of the following industries: Financial Services, Public Sector (Central and /or Local and Regional Government, healthcare and education), Consumer Goods, Retail, Manufacturing, Life Sciences, Energy and Utilities, Telecoms, Media, TechnologyYou are here: ConsultingThree core competency areas make up our Consulting service line:TechnologyStrategy & OperationsHuman CapitalWe exist to solve complex problemsOur consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. With a team of over 3,000, each of us is energised by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.We are committed to collaborationOur role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.We create long-term, sustainable impactWe often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.We offer a number of different career pathwaysWe offer three different career pathways at Deloitte, meaning that there are three different routes by which people can progress in Consulting. We provide variety regarding the career options available to you, assisting you to take career steps that fit your skills, talents and aspirations, and providing an environment where those choices can be discussed in meaningful and constructive career conversations.The Consulting Career Paths are:Consulting pathway – pathway based around developing a broad consulting skillset alongside building expertise in a specific domainConsulting Solutions pathway – pathway where there is greater focus on building skills and deep expertise in a specific domain. Practitioners have a narrow focus, determined by their SME and type of contribution madeConsulting Services pathway – pathway for people whose career is built around the delivery of managed services to clients (either internal or external)About Deloitte Our Purpose & Strategy To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent. What do we do? Deloitte offers Global integrated professional services that include Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. What do we value?At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements. Hear from some of our people already working at Deloitte in agile ways. job_desc: What impact will you make? The Opportunity The Capital Markets Operations practice has a history of building deep and long lasting relationships with our clients. We are proud to provide an unrivalled service and experience through a collaborative partnership with our clients to maximise their effectiveness, efficiency and profitability. Our team is passionate about delivering change to the financial services industry, with digital innovation at the heart of our approach. Our practitioners work on a variety of projects which include, design and delivery of operating models, process transformation and automation, robotics, cost reduction, structural reform and regulatory compliance. The Capital Markets Operations team recognises that our success in the industry is due to our incredible people. We invest heavily in our practitioners providing them with the right tools, training and working flexibility to enable them to deliver and be successful in a rewarding and motivating working environment. Teamwork is also something that we emphasise and bring the Capital Markets Operations team together on a regular basis to share experiences, knowledge, while enjoying quality time with our colleagues. As a Senior Manager in Capital Markets Operations you will work on complex and challenging projects within the Capital Markets industry and across a variety of functions (e.g. operations, front office, risk, compliance, etc.). You will have the opportunity to learn and grow by using the practice’s sophisticated tools and methodologies, whilst having the opportunity to build meaningful client relationships. You will also have the chance to work with and learn from some of the top practitioners in our firm.  Role description To be successful in this role, you will need to have had exposure to project work and be able to understand front-to-back operations as well as the full trade life cycle so that you can translate your findings into tangible solutions. You should also be able to develop strong relationships, contribute innovative ideas, and manage change and ambiguity effectively and confidently. Your existing industry and project management knowledge/experience will be critical and will support your development in the team. We will provide you with the appropriate support to continually develop yourself, add real value and build credibility in the industry from an early stage.You will be a subject matter expert leading multiple, high-profile projects and bids, whilst developing innovative thought leadershipAssignments will be focused across the full spectrum of the capital markets industry and will include:Legal Entity Strategy design and implementation Business Booking Models Optimisation Operating model design and implementation Business architecture Regulatory change analysis and implementation  Location London Hours Permanent role with potential for flexible working Responsibilities As a Senior Manager focussing on Structural Reform in Capital Markets Operations, you will be responsible for understanding the clients' needs and supporting the client with:Entity Strategy for transformation programmes impacting Capital Markets entities; Identifying the regulations affecting the design of a bank’s new strategic structure and booking model for clients; Understanding the impact of “ring fencing” assets / liabilities or businesses on a Bank’s business model and wider considerations perspective; Producing quality deliverables with minimum management oversight This could entail designing and implementing operating models for transformation programmes; Translating regulatory requirements into tangible business transformation and improvements; Analysing processes and functions' cost basis to identify cost reduction opportunities; Documenting, designing, improving or transforming processes using traditional lean methods e.g. robotics, digital solutions and blockchain; Developing new processes and/or business requirements for the relevant functions;You will also be expected to lead and manage more junior team members as well as to support internal projects and business development work.  Requirements To qualify for the role you must have:A background of working Capital Markets Experience in investment banking and capital markets industry, e.g. instruments, such as OTC derivatives, bonds, futures and money market, front-, middle- or back-office processes, market infrastructure, etc. Knowledge of key Structural Reform Initiatives (e.g. Ring fencing / Liikanen, Recovery and Resolution Planning) Experience of one or more elements considered in a legal entity and business booking optimisation programme: This may be for instance ring-fence design, control function design, regulatory capital, liquidity, treasury, Brexit impact analysis, subsidiarisation. Strong understanding and experience of the project lifecycle A thorough understanding of all aspects of the Target Operating Model framework and have had some project experience / exposure to certain components within it Experience managing / mentoring at least 1-2 junior resources Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong problem solving and analytical skills Good relationship management skills Advanced PowerPoint and Excel skills Good project management Proven change management and change delivery ability Travel mobilityAdditional desirable experience includes: Digital change, e.g. new technologies experience, delivery of innovative ideas Experience in implementation of RPA of cognitive technologies Process modelling (e.g. Visio) You are here Three core competency areas make up our Consulting service line: Technology Strategy & Operations Human CapitalWe exist to solve complex problemsOur consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. With a team of over 3,000, each of us is energised by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.We are committed to collaborationOur role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities. We create long-term, sustainable impactWe often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come. We offer a number of different career pathwaysWe offer three different career pathways at Deloitte, meaning that there are three different routes by which people can progress in Consulting. We provide variety regarding the career options available to you, assisting you to take career steps that fit your skills, talents and aspirations, and providing an environment where those choices can be discussed in meaningful and constructive career conversations.The Consulting Career Paths are:Consulting pathway – pathway based around developing a broad consulting skillset alongside building expertise in a specific domain Consulting Solutions pathway – pathway where there is greater focus on building skills and deep expertise in a specific domain. Practitioners have a narrow focus, determined by their SME and type of contribution made Consulting Services pathway – pathway for people whose career is built around the delivery of managed services to clients (either internal or external) About Deloitte Our Purpose & Strategy To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.  How will this role make an impact that matters with Deloitte? Working within this Operations team, you will have hands-on involvement on complex engagements of critical importance within the Public Sector, having a direct impact on UK Defence, Security and Justice systems and processes. What do we do? Deloitte offers Global integrated professional services that include Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. We will provide you with the appropriate support to continually develop yourself, add real value and build credibility in the industry from an early stage.Assignments will be focused across the full spectrum of the capital markets industry and will include:Legal Entity Strategy design and implementation Business Booking Models Optimisation Operating model design and implementation Business architecture Regulatory change analysis and implementation  Location London Hours Permanent role with potential for flexible working Responsibilities As a Manager focussing on Structural Reform in Capital Markets Operations, you will be responsible for understanding the clients' needs and supporting the client with:Entity Strategy for transformation programmes impacting Capital Markets entities; Identifying the regulations affecting the design of a bank’s new strategic structure and booking model for clients; Understanding the impact of “ring fencing” assets / liabilities or businesses on a Bank’s business model and wider considerations perspective; Producing quality deliverables with minimum management oversight This could entail designing and implementing operating models for transformation programmes; Translating regulatory requirements into tangible business transformation and improvements; Analysing processes and functions' cost basis to identify cost reduction opportunities; Documenting, designing, improving or transforming processes using traditional lean methods e.g. robotics, digital solutions and blockchain; Developing new processes and/or business requirements for the relevant functions;You will also be expected to manage more junior team members as well as to lead on internal projects and business development work.  Requirements To qualify for the role you must have:A background of working Capital Markets Experience in investment banking and capital markets industry, e.g. instruments, such as OTC derivatives, bonds, futures and money market, front-, middle- or back-office processes, market infrastructure, etc. Knowledge of key Structural Reform Initiatives (e.g. Ring fencing / Liikanen, Recovery and Resolution Planning) Experience of one or more elements considered in a legal entity and business booking optimisation programme: This may be for instance ring-fence design, control function design, regulatory capital, liquidity, treasury, Brexit impact analysis, subsidiarisation. Strong understanding and experience of the project lifecycle A thorough understanding of all aspects of the Target Operating Model framework and have had some project experience / exposure to certain components within it Experience managing / mentoring at least 1-2 junior resources Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong problem solving and analytical skills Good relationship management skills Advanced PowerPoint and Excel skills Good project management Proven change management and change delivery ability Travel mobilityAdditional desirable experience includes: Digital change, e.g. new technologies experience, delivery of innovative ideas Experience in implementation of RPA of cognitive technologies Process modelling (e.g. Visio) You are here Three core competency areas make up our Consulting service line: Technology Strategy & Operations Human CapitalWe exist to solve complex problemsOur consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. With a team of over 3,000, each of us is energised by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.We are committed to collaborationOur role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities. We create long-term, sustainable impactWe often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come. We offer a number of different career pathwaysWe offer three different career pathways at Deloitte, meaning that there are three different routes by which people can progress in Consulting. We provide variety regarding the career options available to you, assisting you to take career steps that fit your skills, talents and aspirations, and providing an environment where those choices can be discussed in meaningful and constructive career conversations.The Consulting Career Paths are:Consulting pathway – pathway based around developing a broad consulting skillset alongside building expertise in a specific domain Consulting Solutions pathway – pathway where there is greater focus on building skills and deep expertise in a specific domain. Practitioners have a narrow focus, determined by their SME and type of contribution made Consulting Services pathway – pathway for people whose career is built around the delivery of managed services to clients (either internal or external) About Deloitte Our Purpose & Strategy To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.  How will this role make an impact that matters with Deloitte? Working within this Operations team, you will have hands-on involvement on complex engagements of critical importance within the Public Sector, having a direct impact on UK Defence, Security and Justice systems and processes. What do we do? Deloitte offers Global integrated professional services that include Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. What do we value? At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements. Hear from some of our people already working at Deloitte in agile ways. We are proud to have received a Best for All Stages of Motherhood special award in 2016 as a Top Employer for Working Families. Read moreSee All

job_desc: Job ID 22858BR  Job Title Technology Associate  Country United Kingdom  Location Belfast  Local Specialism Deals - Forensic Services  Line of Service Deals  Industry Across all industries  Position Type Full Time  Contract Type Permanent  Job Description Who we arePwC’s Operate is delivering managed services to clients across the UK and Europe. We are growing our capabilities by providing industry specialised training and empowering our colleagues with modern and effective tools. Our client firms appreciate our professionalism, our people's skills and the technology enabled solutions we use to deliver efficient engagements.We continue to invest in our offering and our people by offering the opportunity to take the solid base of skills you’ve developed and improve them by working on complex problems with the right training and systems to support your growth, knowledge and career progression.Who we are looking forPwC Operate is growing its internal technology team to support the implementation of innovative technical solutions to the staff delivering work to the PwC global and client firms. This is a new role in a new team that has been tasked with improving both the technology infrastructure on existing engagements and developing a set of future tooling and software. We’re happy when our colleagues have the data and systems they need to work at their most effectively and get the most satisfaction from their roles.Leveraging broad industry technology trends alongside developing a deep understanding of the problems and inefficiencies we encounter we learn, research, discover, recommend and implement changes to process, tools and systems to help our teams deliver more successful projects while constantly iterating on what our best practice looks like.Initially we’re seeking passionate technology generalists with a solid base set of skills around data, business processes, management reporting and a desire to learn and improve.It would be beneficial to have some practical hands on coding and scripting experience as well as sector experience within Financial Services or a comparable regulated vertical. Curiosity is essential with some knowledge and interest in the areas where technology is changing for example AI and intelligent systems, blockchain and conversational interfaces. A good understanding of what current best practice in delivering technology projects is and how we may leverage things like cloud, DevOps, API’s and agile and testing.The role is based in Belfast and initially travel requirements are expected to be minimalAbout the roleWe support our internal clients with a range of services such as:Designing and developing dashboards, visualisations and metrics to improve understanding of business processes, identify potential weaknesses and provide operational resilienceAssessing processes and current systems to find ways of maximising the value provided by our colleagues.Designing automated and data-driven controls to manage and protect data assetsData Discovery, Data Flow mapping, Data and Process AnalysisValidating and testing data and systemsSharing our knowledge and ideas to make people aware of what is possibleRequirements Strong logical reasoning, attention to detail and problem-solving skills.A formal qualification in technology/maths/engineering (degree level) or equivalent demonstrable industry experience (min 1-2 years)Technically minded, with knowledge of PC functions (e.g. hardware components, networks) and software skills (e.g. various operating systems).EssentialCommunication - the ability to break down and explain technical conceptsBusiness Analysis skills and the ability to engage confidently to accurately determine and document the issues and needs.Some Knowledge and experience with data query and programming languages, such as SQL, C#, VBA, Javascript and/or PythonData Visualisation - understanding and applying different and appropriate visualizations to make date easier to understand.Productivity software including Google Apps for work or Microsoft OfficePersonal Development focused with a learning mentalityInterested and inspired by the benefits technology can deliverRisk aware and always conscious of data protection and security.Relational Database skills with specific experience in at least one tool in a production setting.Desirable:Any Financial Services or comparable sector experienceAny background in delivering R&D projects where outcomes have been uncertainAny graphic / design skills especially around human centred design, design thinking and rapid prototyping using tools like sketch and invision.Designing engaging presentations  About Us About PwCWe’re one of the world’s leading professional services organisations. From 158 countries, we help our clients, some of the most successful organisations on the globe, as well as its most dynamic entrepreneurs and thriving private businesses, to create the value they want. We help to measure, protect and enhance the things that matter most to them.Internal firm servicesIn order to deliver a first-class service to our clients, we need first-class support internally. Internal firm services is a network of specialist support professionals and includes marketing, recruitment, human capital, finance, technology, learning and development, procurement, to name but a few. Each team plays a vital role in making sure we have all the right resources, services and technology across our business.The skills we look for in future employeesAll our people need to demonstrate the skills and behaviours that support us in delivering our business strategy. This is important to the work we do for our business, and our clients. These skills and behaviours make up our global leadership framework, ‘The PwC Professional’ and are made up of five core attributes; whole leadership, technical capabilities, business acumen, global acumen and relationships.Learn more here www.pwc.com/uk/careers/experienced/applyDiversityWe work in a changing world which offers great opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool, as well as those who reflect the diverse nature of our society. And we aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. Creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business and as an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we're open to flexible working arrangements where appropriate.Learn more here www.pwc.com/uk/diversity Read moreSee All

job_desc: Job ID 16661BR Job Title London Top Tier - Strategy & Transformation - Senior Associate Country United Kingdom Location London Local Specialism Assurance - IT Risk Assurance Line of Service Assurance Industry Across all industries Position Type Full Time Contract Type Permanent Job Description About the roleYou will assist in managing end to end delivery of strategy and transformation engagements for a range of FTSE 100 clients. You can expect to be working in any of these sectors. However, you will be expected to have or develop sector expertise.  PwC’s Risk Assurance specialists offer knowledge and expertise in areas including IT systems and programmes, business systems and governance, business resilience, commercial assurance, cyber security, data assurance, performance assurance, treasury and external and internal audit. Although your role will be focused on Strategy and transfromation, you can expect to be work alongside specialists from other areas.About the TeamThe London Top Tier Programme Assurance practice is looking for Senior Associates to join its successful and growing team. The ideal candidate will have experience of large transformation programmes or complex business systems, such as SAP or Oracle. The ideal candidate will have expertise using leading portfolio, programme and project management practices such as agile project delivery, performance data analytics, programme management office development and operation, portfolio planning and delivery and benefit realisation. We are also interested in individuals with emerging tech experience such as Blockchain, RPA (Robotics Process Automation), IoT or other Industry 4.0 technology.Responsibilities  You will be expected to deliver existing business:Assisting in the delivery of relevant engagements, working to meet client expectations and commitments.Ensuring clients are billed correctly and payments are being made on time.Ensuring risk and quality expectations are met or exceeded.You will be expected to develop our programme assurance capabilities:Taking an active role in coaching and developing skills in the team and in other solutions sets.Working to increase awareness of programme assurance across London Top Tier.Requirements  Essential skills, qualifications and experienceExperience of large transformation project/ programme managementTechnology experience (e.g. but not limited to SAP, Oracle, Cloud. job_desc: Harvey Nash have an outstanding opportunity for a hands-on Software Development team lead to join a thriving financial organisation in Warrington.  The company are in the process of modernising their entire tech estate, with the view to working at the absolute forefront of technology. They champion productive agile techniques such as Story Mapping, SCRUM, Kanban, and Lean Software Development.  They are looking to move into a Microservices, Dev-Ops environment as well as becoming ‘cloud agnostic’ to their client base – so not limited to just one cloud platform like Azure/AWS etc! They are also looking at how they can utilise Blockchain technologies to enhance their work – so this represents a really unique opportunity to work with the very latest, industry-breaking tech.  As such, the Software Development team is a crucial role to the organisation, as you will play a major part in this ambitious transformation. The role will be 70% hands-on, 30% team leadership duties, so provides a nice blend of the two without losing your programming work.  In collaboration with the Development Manager and other stakeholders, you will play a key role in setting strategic and technical direction for solutions developed by the company.  You will ensure requirements are analysed and communicated, development plans are defined and maintained and solution designs are identified and evolved through development The successful Software Development team lead will demonstrate the following: LeadershipTeam management of a highly technical development teamStrong experience working on the development of highly transactional, data-centric and client-facing applications and servicesStrong experience in leading across multiple development projects at onceExtensive Microsoft .net framework experience (2-4.5)C#MVCWeb APIEntity FrameworkWeb formsWCF ServicesDev Express Asp.Net MVC extensions (desirable)JavaScriptjQueryJSONAngular and/or knockout (desirable) This is a superb opportunity to work as the spearhead for a talented team developing solutions utilising the latest technology. On top of this, the successful candidate will be rewarded with a starting salary between £60,000 and £70,000 plus bonus and other benefits.  Please submit your CV to Alexander Goodwin - (Apply online only) Read moreSee All

job_desc: What is the role? You would take a lead on ensuring that the theoretical fault tolerance of our EVM-based blockchain Hyperledger Burrow translates to robustness in a practical sense - by understanding the issues of operability, maintenance, human error, and unfortunate or worst-case events. Our consensus mechanism Tendermint has integrity and authenticity of data baked in at its core - but the technology is still immature. As we move to launch our Agreements Network (see below) we need to ensure we mitigate failure risks, minimize blast radius, build appropriate circuit breakers, and have second and third line disaster recovery plans for our platform. Since we are dealing with representing real value on our platform we need to be able to maintain correctness, even if that means stopping the world, reverting state, and providing manual resolution in the worst case. In our master-less architecture providing these guarantees is made harder and requires careful consideration.  Although some of our systems are new we believe in a heterogeneous cloud where traditional systems integrate with decentralised ones. Blockchains and decentralised storage systems are closely related to existing distributed databases and object stores. The focus of your role will be around our Kubernetes-based deployment and blending blockchain-land with more traditional (and battle-tested) DevOps and cloud tooling. We see integration between these two worlds as critical to our success and issues such as message queuing, API management, caching, logging, and metrics are all key to that goal.  You would be officially part of the Platform team but your role will be one of the most wide-ranging in the company across all of our teams - platform, legal engineering, smart contract development, and product. All of the components that make up the Agreements Network need the ability to fail gracefully - and then recover.  You will also have the opportunity to write core code for the platform in support of your reliability engineering role. What do we think we need? Someone who: A competent developer who can read Go, Javascript (NodeJS and frontend), Solidity (EVM code), and shell scripts within the first few weeksHas a non-trivial understanding of cloud native tooling such as Kubernetes, Helm, Elasticsearch, and Prometheus.Has basic working knowledge of AWS and GCE.Has at least two years worth of multi-server non-trivial cloud deployments - ideally with containersWho can continuously improve and refine our processes - deployment, CI, testing - without promptingWho can plan, re-prioritise, and switch contexts with ease - creating just enough documentation so others have visibilityCan help the team avoid mistakes by positively challenging possible misstepsCan pinpoint cross-team reliability issues and take responsibility for things not 'falling between the gaps'Can interact with different teams with empathy to understand why reliability or correctness issues exist and how to help resolve themPromotes collective responsibility and breaks down siloed thinking by making things their problem Of particular importance is that you are able to take part in a forceful yet respectful technical argument with colleagues, that you are able to change your mind about something, and to change other’s minds. About Monax Monax were pioneers of permissioned ledgers and smart contracts and now we are building a legal agreements network to allow new and more efficient forms of legal transacting, exploiting the benefits of various decentralised, distributed, and masterless technologies.  Monax would like to build a better system for contracting for the good of humanity and other forms of life. In particular we would like to: Harness lawyers and lawyering in a way that lowers rental and intermediary costs in the market (e.g. having to run a law firm or requiring an audit to understand in-flight agreement processes) while also enabling lawyers to “productize” their previously bespoke servicesLaunch decentralised networks on which to record and interact with agreements that can be operated by all parties on an equal footing.Automate paper-based legal processes and document tennis between parties.Allow the decentralised networks to execute elements of agreement process acting as a virtual trusted intermediary.Who will you be working with? We are approximately ten people, so to some extent everyone, but most closely with the platform team. This will consist of: Monax’s CTO -- who will be your direct supervisorMonax's CEO who has taken the lead role in developing our cloud deployment so far and based in Edinburgh and with whom you will have a close working relationshipOther new team members more focussed on core platform codeThree full-time developers from Tata Consulting Services who are partnering with us to work on BurrowExtra help on demand from 1-2 freelance developersContributors from Hyperledger community including IBM and Intel from the Fabric and Sawtooth Lake projects collaborating on our EVMWhat can the job offer?Helping blockchain systems live up to some of their hype by making them highly operable - our network will ultimately be operated by many parties and this needs to be as painless as possibleExperience in blending together distributed, decentralised, and centralised systemsExtremely marketable blockchain and cryptocurrencies skills.Opportunity to spend time working on something foundational at the level of a network architecture - something that is worth time spent finely honing.Building a genuinely novel system that in part intends to create an entirely new market.Spend time thinking ‘around the software’; about law, economics, and game theory.Flexible working - we have regular discussions online and we want more time spent in the same room within teams - but outside this pick your hours and place of work (we have workspace Edinburgh).High level of autonomy and just enough hierarchy - consensus and individual project responsibility (c.f. design-by-committee) favoured over diktats.Real examples of things you might work on For Burrow we have a full, public roadmap of things to deliver in Q1.  Some things the platform team has been doing in the last three months: Attending a Hyperledger hackfest in LisbonDiagnosing a bug deep in the concurrent list implementation used by our consensus engine based on an unsafe/pointer and Go’s memory layoutImplementing a simple stack-based language for building logging pipelinesRefactoring a few thousands lines of Burrow (https://github.com/hyperledger/burrow/pull/666)Researching a tool for generating petri-nets from BPMN processesAssisting with an academic project looking into voting on the blockchain: http://volt-project.org/ Some projects requiring near-term attention: Deploy and run IPFS nodes with pinningImplement our key signing interface against a cloud based hardware security modelProvide additional security features for validators joining the networkWork out how to perform network initialisation - public key gossip and PKIDevelop in cluster monitoring and automatic failover for blockchain nodes which have fallen out of consensus or are no longer connected into their peers. Based in London, but with customers from across the UK, Europe and around the world, our vision is to empower customers to share their data on their terms using the latest cutting-edge technology.  At heart, were using information to improve the way people live. Currently, were building a private asset vault on the blockchain, enabling people to store, protect and manage the things they love while also offering them the worlds first truly intelligent and personalised home insurance. Weve got a track record of rapid growth and backing from some of the worlds leading investors.  Were always looking for top talent to help us realise our vision of a secure, data-empowered future. Do you have what it takes to join our team? job_desc: The Senior Manager Post-Trade and Technology Regulatory Strategy is responsible for supporting the Post-Trade and Technology regulatory strategy across the geographic areas as appropriate for the business (CPMI IOSCO guidance, FSB guidance, Dodd Frank, Great Repeal Bill, EMIR, CCP Recovery & Resolution, CSDR, Stress Testing, Location Policy and third country CCP recognition, ESA Review, Distributed Ledger / Blockchain, Big Data, Data Protection, Cyber Security…). The Senior Manager reports to the Global Head of Post Trade and Technology Regulatory Strategy. He/she needs to understand the Post Trade and Technology regulatory policy sphere, feed into the strategy and prioritisation of the issues that LSEG needs to lobby on and the assessment of the short, medium and long term regulatory policy risks and opportunities for the Group under the supervision of the Global Head of Post Trade and Technology Regulatory Strategy. The Senior Manager supports the strategy for the Group’s Post-Trade and Technology businesses success by feeding into the development, coordination and communication the Group’s positions on the relevant regulatory proposals and policies. The Senior Manager works in close and full cooperation with her/his colleagues from the Government Relations team, based in the territories (EU, UK, US, APAC, MENA) as required by the regulatory campaigns. The Senior Manager is expected to be a strong support to the Global Head of Post Trade and Technology Regulatory Strategy. Finally, close cooperation with his/her peers, horizontal thinking, team spirit and intellectual emulation will be expected as part of being a member of the Regulatory Strategy team. Key ResponsibilitiesReliable, structured and efficient support to the Global Head of Post-Trade and Technology Regulatory Strategy team. Excellence, proactive thinking and autonomy as and when required. Maintain excellent relationship with the relevant LSEG business partners, continuously work to understand their projects, visions, client base, and competitive positioning and feed into the team’s regulatory strategy accordingly. Support the definition of targeted and structured advice to the business to enable their growth and vision while protecting them from the regulatory and political landscape when needed. Actively participate in the shaping of a Post-trade and Technology Post Brexit strategy for his/her assigned businesses. Analyse and make proposal to optimise business external exposure, accompany where required. Think creatively and in full cooperation with his/her peers. Actively support rigorous, timely, agile analysis of business risks and opportunities arising from Global regulatory proposals (EU, UK, US, APAC, MENA), consulting with internal stakeholders, as appropriate, to feed into Group positions on key Post Trade and Technology issues. Properly coordinate with all relevant business stakeholders across the relevant geographic regions for each relevant file. Be accountable for structured, filtered for decision-making, clear written analysis of the Post Trade and Technology regulatory developments to be provided to the Global Head of Post Trade and Technology to help her/him measure impact on businesses, work out scenarios and recommend appropriate action. Be conscious of the prioritisation required on the basis of revenue, business and reputational risks.Feed into high-quality technical position papers / briefings / consultation responses.Get involved, elected where needed (as decided by the Global Head of Post Trade and Technology), in the relevant industry associations, think tank and working groups as rightly fits into the agreed Post-Trade and Technology strategy. Support business representatives in these fora, as appropriate. Build and maintain deep and trusted relationships with regulatory policymakers on relevant files.Represent LSEG in diverse forum including bilateral meetings with key decision-makers, industry participants and associations (in coordination with the Global Head of Post Trade and Technology). Participate and represent LSEG in events such as conferences and industry/regulators forum (in coordination with the Global Head of Post Trade and Technology).Be fully co-responsible with other members of the Post Trade and Technology Regulatory Strategy team to feed into the appropriate reports for top management and ExCo level on the activities of the Regulatory Strategy department.Key BehavioursPartnership: Excellent team ethic and proven ability to lead projects and work collaboratively.Excellence: Excellent analytical, cross-regional regulatory analysis, written and oral communication skills. Proactive involvement and autonomy.Innovation: Able to take ownership as required by management, propose direction and demonstrate excellent execution skills to the end of a project. Strong strategic thinking required.Integrity: Able to establish rapport and credibility with key individuals in full cooperation with his/her colleagues from Government relations. Full reliability for line manager required. Strong engagement in the team expected.Candidate Profile/ Key SkillsExcellent detailed analytical and problem solving skills – strong experience of analysing UK and / or European and / or US financial services regulation is required.Delivery – ability to deliver high-quality work according to line manager strategy, business goals and deadlines. Ability to provide structured feedback, clarity and transparency – essential.Sound experience working with legislative institutions (EU, UK, US, more is desirable) and decision making process – essential.Experience of financial services applicable to the Group’s Post-Trade and Technology activities - essential.Managing relationships – ability to build and maintain the relevant network of contacts, internally and externally. Ability to manage up and support colleagues.Communication - must project good personal credibility, be able to seek input from line manager, colleagues and expert in the business, show active listening skills, ability to check understanding, demonstrate excellent written communication skills at all levels, actively supporting well structured, persuasive, concise and factually supported advocacy and analysis. Proven ability to lead on specific issues in autonomy, working proactively to achieve the optimum outcomes in line with line manager strategy, manage skilled external and internal stakeholders and provide full clarity to reporting line – essential. People are at the heart of what we do and drive the success of our business. Our colleagues thrive personally and professionally through our shared values of Integrity, Partnership, Innovation and Excellence are at the core of our culture. We embrace diversity and actively seek to attract people with unique backgrounds and perspectives. We are always looking at ways to become more agile so we meet the needs of our teams and customers. We believe that an inclusive collaborative workplace is pivotal to our success and supports the potential and growth of all colleagues at LSEG.  A career with London Stock Exchange Group offers you the opportunity to be at the centre of the financial community. As well as competitive salaries and a range of attractive benefits, we maximise each employee’s potential through personal development plans, training, coaching and mentoring. Read moreSee All

job_desc: BitGo, a global leader in digital currency security, provides sophisticated digital wallets, offline vaults, single integration APIs, and private blockchains to financial institutions. BitGo supports Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Litecoin, Bitcoin Cash, Bitcoin Gold, RMG, and ERC20 tokens, with many more being continuously released. BitGo’s clients include the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges and financial enterprises conducting over $12 billion in monthly transactions: Bitstamp, The Royal Mint, The CME Group, Bitbank, BitBay, Brave, KCoin, Ripple, Bitcoin IRA, CoinPayments, Pantera, Genesis, Wirex, Bitso, and many more.  BitGo Inc. was founded in 2013 in Palo Alto, CA and is led by CEO/Co-Founder Mike Belshe, creator of the world’s first multisig protocols for Bitcoin, and author of SPDY, and CTO Benedict Chan, creator of the world’s first Ethereum multisig wallet. BitGo raised over $54.5 million in funding led by Valor Equity Partners, Redpoint Ventures, DRW, and David Sacks among other capital investors. BitGo recently announced its pending acquisition of Kingdom Trust, a fully regulated trust company serving over 100,000 clients with over $12 billion in assets under custody. This acquisition will make the combined companies the only full-stack, at scale provider of onsite and online protection for digital currency investments held by institutional investors. RESPONSIBILITIESRespond to inbound requests and develop new sales opportunitiesSchedule calls with prospective clients, do demos of our products and sell, sell, sellNegotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profitsEnsure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectivesClearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholdersForecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts)Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as neededEnsure timely accounting and payments in line with client activity and transaction volumeRequirementsMinimum 3-5 years of proven work experience in direct sales, with proven sales achievementsMust be a passionate about hunter-type sales professionalStrong understanding of BitGo's products and industry - digital wallets, cryptocurrencies, digital assets, etc.Prior experience in a tech startup is a huge plusAble to work remotely and coordinate the HQ in Palo AltoExcellent communication, business acumen and presentation skillsMust be a self-starter, resourceful, multitasker with a winning attitudeBenefitsOpportunity to work for a true fast growing tech startup in one of the hottest industriesOpportunity to work with an awesome team of unique and smart peopleCompetitive salary, bonus and stock optionsFully paid health insurance, including spouse and kidsUnlimited paid time off and paid holidaysFree catered lunches (order what you want online)Free parking and Caltrain passesOnsite fully stocked kitchen with healthy snacks, fruits and drinksOnsite espresso machine with freshly ground coffee (Phil’z, Verve)Work equipment of your choice (apple machines, standing desks)Why Join BitGo Building disruptive products takes vision, innovation, passion, technical chops, drive to deliver, collaboration and execution. In a nutshell great people, who strive for excellence in all their endeavors who have a track record of success! We are looking for candidates who “think out of the box”, are not risk adverse and want to build products that change the world. We aspire to provide a working environment, culture and leadership team that inspires greatness on a daily basis offering transparency, ownership and integrity.  Bitcoin will change the financial industry! Join our team in building one of the next technologies that will change the world or wait by the sidelines! Our FoundersMike Belshe is a veteran technologist who invented the multi-signature protocols used at Bitgo. Prior, Mike worked at Google on the founding of Google Chrome, was the co-inventor and driving force behind SPDY (which has now become HTTP/2.0 and co-founded Lookout Software acquired by Microsoft. Ben Davenport is a technology entrepreneur and investor who had been deeply involved in Bitcoin since 2011. He co-founded Beluga which was sold to Facebook. Prior, Ben worked at Google and Microsoft.
